basics.name: Jonathan Z. Ong
basics.label: Research Assistant
basics.summary: Research assistant interested in infant social cognition, parent–child synchrony, and multimodal neurophysiological methods (EEG, ECG, behavior). Experienced in experimental design, analytical pipeline development, and cross‑disciplinary team coordination.

work.name: Nanyang Technological University
work.summary: Coordinate an interdisciplinary team (psychologists, neuroscientists, engineers, AI/data‑scientists) developing novel social‑interaction metrics for infant executive‑function prediction.
highlights: Perform multimodal data collection and preprocessing (EEG, ECG, behavior) for parent‑infant dyads.
Design naturalistic tasks assessing executive functions in 6–36‑month‑olds.
Develop pipelines to synchronise data streams and compute dyadic behavioral and neural metrics.

work.name: Sunway University
work.summary: AGEWELL project on neurocognitive ageing in Malaysia.
highlights: Recruited socio‑economically diverse older‑adult cohort (60+ years).
Administered neuropsychological assessments and EEG recordings.
Performed ERP preprocessing in MATLAB and GLM analyses in R.

work.name: Monash University Malaysia
work.summary: Supported multiple social‑psychology and cultural‑psychology projects.
highlights: Conducted literature reviews; transcribed and translated qualitative data.
Applied Actor‑Partner Interdependence Models to dyadic interaction data.
Co‑organised the Southeast Asian Indigenous Psychology Scientific Meetings (2021, 2022).

work.name: SK & SMK Bandar Tun Hussein Onn 2 (Malaysia)
work.summary: Taught elementary and high‑school classes (~30 students per class).

volunteer.summary: Taught English to a class of 15 Chin refugee children.

volunteer.organization: Southeast Asian Indigenous Psychology Scientific Meeting
volunteer.summary: Co‑ordinated two international meetings bringing regional scholars together to advance indigenous psychology.

education.thesis: Interpersonal Neural Synchrony Mechanisms for Parent–Offspring Social Learning
education.summary: Multimodal project (EEG, ECG, behavior) and optogenetic mouse model investigating neural mechanisms of social learning.

education.thesis: Romantic Dispositions and Romantic Need Prioritization in Single Adult Malaysians: The Moderating Role of Gender

awards.title: A*STAR Fully‑Sponsored Master’s Studentship
awards.awarder: Agency for Science, Technology and Research & Nanyang Technological University
awards.summary: Full tuition and stipend (~USD 70,000) for MA studies.

awards.title: Best Graduate Award
awards.summary: Top graduate of the BPsych(Hons) cohort.

awards.title: Undergraduate Studies Loan Exemption
awards.awarder: Malaysian National Higher Education Fund Corporation
awards.summary: Full exemption (~USD 6,200) for outstanding academic performance.

awards.title: Best Graduate Award
awards.summary: Top graduate of the BPsych cohort.

publications.name: It’s a guy thing: Sex as a moderator of the relationship between social anxiety and perception of interpersonal warmth in initial heterosexual interactions
publications.summary: Examines sex differences in how social anxiety influences perceived warmth in first‑time heterosexual interactions.

publications.name: Protocol to study dam‑pup social transmission using a modified paradigm for transmission of food preference
publications.summary: Presents an optogenetic‑compatible protocol to investigate neural mechanisms of social learning in mouse dam‑pup dyads.

projects.name: Sociometric AI Screening Tool to Risk-Stratify Infant Neurodevelopmental Trajectories
projects.summary: Multimodal (EEG, ECG, behavior) AI pipeline to risk‑stratify infant neurodevelopmental trajectories.
highlights: Task design for executive‑function assessment in 6–36‑month‑olds.
Data‑stream synchronisation and novel metric computation.

projects.name: Optogenetic Parent-Offspring Mouse Model of Neural Synchrony and Social Learning
projects.summary: Adapted social transmission of food preference paradigm with optogenetics to probe causal role of prefrontal synchrony in social learning.
highlights: Breeding and genotyping PV‑Cre/ChR2 mouse lines.
In vivo optogenetic manipulation and histological verification.
